original: e. Make available,  during normal business hours, at a Party=s offices all records, books, agreements, policies and procedures relating to the use and/or  disclosure  of  Confidential  Information  that is  subject to this Agreement,  to the other  Party  within ten (10) days of a Party's  written request,  for the purpose of  enabling a Party to verify the other  Party=s compliance with the terms of this Agreement; f. Within  fifteen  (15) days of  receiving a written  request  from a Party,  provide to the other Party such  information  as is  requested by a Party to permit the other  Party to  respond  to a request  by the  subject individual for amendment and accounting  purposes of the disclosures of the individual=s Confidential Information; g.  Return to a Party or  destroy,  as  requested  by a Party,  within fifteen (15) days of the  termination of this Agreement,  any  Confidential Information  provided  to such  Party and in its  possession  and retain no copies or back-up tapes; h. Parties agrees to mitigate, to the extent practicable,  any harmful effect  that is  known to a Party of a use or  disclosure  of  Confidential Information by a Party in violation of the requirements of this Agreement; i. To inform a Party of any  changes  in the form of notice of privacy practices  that the other  Party  provides to  individuals  and provide the Party a copy of the notice currently in use; and j. To  inform  the Party of any  changes  in, or  withdrawal  of,  the consent  or  authorization   provided  to  a  Party  by  individuals  whose Confidential Information may be used and/or disclosed by a Party under this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
e'. Upon reasonable notice during non-business hours, at either Party's discretion, make accessible all records, books, agreements, policies, and procedures concerning the use and/or disclosure of Confidential Information under this Agreement, to the other Party, for the purpose of enabling a Party to verify the other Party's compliance with this Agreement. However, the response time may extend up to thirty (30) days in case of inconvenience or exceptional circumstances.
   f'. Within forty-five (45) days of receiving a written request from a Party, provide any requested information that allows the other Party to respond to an individual's request for amendment and accounting purposes regarding their Confidential Information.
   g'. Upon termination of this Agreement, return or destroy, as requested by either Party, any Confidential Information provided to such Party within thirty (30) days, while retaining the right to maintain copies or back-up tapes for archival purposes and up to one year thereafter.
   h'. Parties shall make reasonable efforts, to the extent practicable, to minimize any harmful effect that is known to a Party as a result of a breach by either Party regarding the use or disclosure of Confidential Information in violation of this Agreement's requirements.
   i'. Provide notice of changes in the form of privacy practices notice given to individuals and offer a copy of the current notice in use to the other Party upon request.
   j'. Inform the other Party of any changes made, or withdrawal of, the consent or authorization provided by individuals whose Confidential Information may be used and/or disclosed under this Agreement, but only upon the request of the Party. The initial notification shall take place within ten (10) days following such change or withdrawal.

original: c. Effect of Termination.  Upon termination of this Agreement, for any reason, each Party hereto shall return to the other Party, or destroy,  all of such Party's  Confidential  Information  in the  possession of the other Party.  This provision shall apply to Confidential  Information  that is in the possession of  subcontractors or agents of each Party. Each Party shall retain no copies of the Confidential  Information of the other Party except as may be required by law.
ollama_generated:
c. Implications of Termination. Upon termination of this Agreement, regardless of the cause, it is incumbent upon each Party to either safeguard or irreversibly eliminate all Confidential Information that they possess within the other Party's domain. This obligation extends to any Confidential Information held by subcontractors or representatives acting on behalf of either Party. Under no circumstances shall either Party retain unauthorized copies of the Confidential Information belonging to the other Party, except when mandated by law.

In this revised clause, the emphasis has shifted from an obligation for immediate return or destruction of Confidential Information upon termination to a more passive "safeguard or irreversibly eliminate". This weakening allows some flexibility in how the parties handle the information post-termination while still ensuring that the confidential data is protected. The clause now also includes the phrase "under no circumstances" which strengthens the prohibition against retaining unauthorized copies, but only when specifically mandated by law.

original: b. Amendment. This Agreement may not be modified or amended, except in writing as agreed to by each Party.
ollama_generated: c. Modification and Amendments: Any attempts to modify or amend this Agreement can only be made through mutual, written consent of both Parties. However, either Party retains the right to unilaterally alter this Agreement if such changes are necessitated by applicable law or regulation, upon providing reasonable notice to the other Party.
